"Smart" electric toothbrush: This toothbrush would be equipped with sensors and AI technology to analyze the user's brushing habits and provide personalized recommendations for optimal oral health. It could also track the user's progress over time and send reminders to replace the brush head.

"Fusion" electric toothbrush: This toothbrush would combine the benefits of an electric toothbrush with the benefits of a waterpik. It would have a built-in water jet that would help to remove food particles and bacteria from between teeth and along the gum line.

"Eco-friendly" electric toothbrush: This toothbrush would be made from sustainable materials and be designed to be rechargeable. It would also have a feature that allows the user to track their water usage while brushing, encouraging them to conserve water.

"App-connected" electric toothbrush: This toothbrush would be connected to a mobile app that would allow the user to track their brushing habits, set goals, and receive reminders. The app could also provide educational resources and tips for oral health.

"Dual-head" electric toothbrush: This toothbrush would have two heads, one for cleaning teeth and one for massaging gums. The gum massaging head would have soft bristles and a gentle pressure to help improve blood flow and reduce inflammation.
